item.title: FEMA Administrator Meets with South Carolina Governor (007)
item.description: West Columbia, S.C. (Oct. 24, 2024) - FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell visited South Carolina's Emergency Operations Center to meet with Governor Henry McMasters for a briefing on the recovery efforts from Hurricane Helene. Also in attendance was FEMA Deputy Regional Administrator Robert Ashe, S.C. Emergency Management Division Director Kim Stenson and alongside FEMA Federal Coordinating Officer, Brett Howard and other FEMA officials.

item.title: FEMA’s Acting Deputy Administrator of Resilience Visits Collettsville (007)
item.description: Collettsville, N.C. (October 22, 2024) - Victoria Salinas, FEMA’s Senior Official Performing the Duties of Deputy Administrator surveys the flood damage from Wilson Creek along Brown Mountain Road with members of the Collettsville, North Carolina Fire Department. Salinas also talked with the owners of the Brown Mountain Resort as they shared their story of surviving the flood from Hurricane Helene.

(October 22, 2024) - Victoria Salinas, FEMA’s Senior Official Performing the Duties of Deputy Administrator surveys the flood damage from Wilson Creek along Brown Mountain Road with members of the Collettsville, North Carolina Fire Department. Salinas also talked with the owners of the Brown Mountain Resort as they shared their story of surviving the flood from Hurricane Helene.

item.title: Preliminary Damage Assessment Team in Montgomery County (007)
item.description: Montgomery County, Va. (Oct. 1, 2024) - A U.S. Small Business Administration specialist documents damages to a home affected by high water days after the New River flooded its banks. A team comprised of Montgomery County emergency managers, Virginia Department of Emergency Management, the U.S. Small Business Administration, and FEMA was reviewing Montgomery County properties impacted by Tropical Storm Helene.

item.title: FEMA and SBA's Associate Administrators Visit Spartanburg's Emergency Operation Center in SC. (015)
item.description: Spartanburg, S.C. (Oct. 21, 2024) - FEMA Associate Administrators Justin Knighten and Michael George, alongside SBA Associate Administrator Han Nguyen, visits Spartanburg's Emergency Operation Center to attend a briefing roundtable with State and Local Emergency Management, First Responders, & Non-Profit organization to discuss response and recovery efforts. The Associate Administrators met with Spartanburg County's Emergency Management Director Doug Bryson, Coordinator Robbie Swofford, South Carolina Emergency Management Division Director Kim Stenson, among other First Responder Staff alongside FEMA Federal Coordinating Officer, Brett Howard.

(Oct. 21, 2024) - FEMA Associate Administrators Justin Knighten and Michael George, alongside SBA Associate Administrator Han Nguyen, visits Stone Avenue Fire Station in Greenvill, SC. The Associate Administrators met with Fire Chief Brian Horton among other fire officials for a briefing and a tour the Hurricane Helene impacts to fire station.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Canvass Neighborhoods in Western Virginia (011)
item.description: Wythe County, Va. (Oct. 17, 2024) - A FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialist observes FEMA Corps members sharing application information with people outside of their home. FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams are making their way through western Virginia to help survivors impacted by Tropical Storm Helene.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Canvass Neighborhoods in Western Virginia (010)
item.description: Marion, Va. (Oct. 5, 2024) - FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialists review damages covered under Individual Assistance with a resident. Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams focus on visiting impacted areas in order to share information on disaster aid.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Help Suriviors Apply for Aid in Western Virginia (009)
item.description: Taylors Valley, Va. (Oct. 4, 2024) - A Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialist helps a survivor apply for federal assistance at the Taylors Valley Community Center.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Help Suriviors Apply for Aid in Western Virginia (007)
item.description: Taylors Valley, Va. (Oct. 4, 2024) - A FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialist checks her equipment near a water station at the Taylors Valley Community Center days after flooding knocked out the town’s water supply.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Canvass Neighborhoods in Western Virginia (006)
item.description: Damascus, Va. (Oct. 3, 2024) - A FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialist talks with a resident regarding his destroyed home. FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams are in the area to help survivors of Tropical Storm Helene apply for federal aid.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Canvass Neighborhoods in Western Virginia (005)
item.description: Damascus, Va. (Oct. 3, 2024) - A FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Team Lead prepares notes ahead of remarks at an informational gathering of residents with Washington County, Virginia Department of Emergency Management and other FEMA officials. FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams are in Damascus to help survivors of Tropical Storm Helene apply for federal aid.

item.title: Disaster Survivor Assistance Teams Canvass Neighborhoods in Western Virginia (004)
item.description: Damascus, Va. (Oct. 3, 2024) - A FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Team checks their equipment before going out to help residents of neighborhoods impacted by flooding apply for disaster aid after Tropical Storm Helene.

item.title: FEMA Conducts Damage Assessments in Western Virginia (003)
item.description: Pulaski County, Va. (Oct. 2, 2024) - AmeriCorps members survey remaining debris at a residence days after flooding from the New River. A team, comprised of Pulaski County emergency managers, Virginia Department of Emergency Management, the U.S. Small Business Administration, and FEMA was reviewing Pulaski County properties impacted by Tropical Storm Helene.

item.title: FEMA Conducts Damage Assessments in Western Virginia (002)
item.description: Pulaski County, Va. (Oct. 2, 2024) - A member of the Pulaski County Fire Department goes over an AmeriCorps debris removal project with a FEMA specialist at a residence days after flooding from the New River. A team, comprised of Pulaski County emergency managers, Virginia Department of Emergency Management, the U.S. Small Business Administration, and FEMA was reviewing Pulaski County properties impacted by Tropical Storm Helene.

item.title: FEMA Conducts Damage Assessments in Western Virginia (001)
item.description: Pulaski County, Va. (Oct. 2, 2024) - A FEMA specialist documents damage to a home days after flooding from the New River. item.title: FEMA Administrator Visits Recovery Operations in Virginia (011)
item.description: Damascus, Va. (October 17th, 2024) - FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell visits the community of Damascus after Hurricane Helene caused widespread damage to the area. Criswell also met with Governor Glenn Youngkin and Mayor Katie Lamb to talk about the ongoing recovery efforts at the local, state and federal level.

item.title: PODS to People in Buncombe County, North Carolina (007)
item.description: Buncombe County, N.C. - In coordination with partners at the Department of Defense, Buncombe County and the City of Asheville, PODS (Points of Distribution) to People is provide commodities to more limited access areas, and those communities that might have a more difficult time getting to a fixed location.

item.title: Preliminary Damage Assessments Conducted in Lee County, Virginia
item.description: Lee County, Va. - An outbuilding crushed by a fallen tree is among the damages observed. A group comprised of staff from the Lee County 911, Virginia Department of Emergency Management, the U.S. Small Business Administration, and FEMA was conducting Preliminary Damage Assessments to survey properties affected by Tropical Storm Helene in September.

item.title: FEMA Helps Survivors at Community Care Stations (003)
item.description: Swannanoa, NC - FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance staff help survivors at a Community Care Station. FEMA, Buncombe County, City of Asheville and the private sector have worked together to offer showers, laundry, bathrooms, access to cell towers, hot food, water, Wi-Fi, and medicine.

item.title: FEMA Deputy Administrator Visits Carter County Emergency Center
item.description: Carter County, Tenn. (Oct. 9, 2024) - FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks and FEMA Region 8 Regional Administrator Nancy Dragani visits Carter County Emergency Center on Oct. 9. They were accompanied by the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency and local emergency managers to discuss individual assistance and ways to get support to those in need.

item.title: FEMA Deputy Administrator Visits Tennessee Multi-Agency Disaster Relief Center
item.description: Tenn. (Oct. 9, 2024) - FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks speaking with a Tennessee Sheriff at the Multi-Agency Resource Center, where survivors can get a wide range of support. The American Red Cross had a table and van to hand out food, water and information packets.

item.title: FEMA Deputy Administrator Visits Tennessee Multi-Agency Disaster Relief Center
item.description: Tenn. (Oct. 9, 2024) - FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks speaking with a Tennessee Sheriff at the Multi-Agency Resource Center, where survivors can get a wide range of support. The American Red Cross had a table and van to hand out food, water and information packets. FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance teams have helped many residents who lost homes and businesses apply for disaster assistance.

item.title: FEMA Deputy Administrator Visits Bristol Motor Speedway's Northeast Tennessee Disaster Relief Center
item.description: Bristol, Tenn. (Oct. 9, 2024) - FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks visits over 150 volunteers at Bristol Motor Speedway's 80,000-square-foot warehouse. Speedway loaned the warehouse to the state government to house donated relief supplies, now known as the Northeast Tennessee Disaster Relief Center. FEMA tractor trailers bring commodities in daily, and volunteers sort out donations from all over the country for distribution back to the community.

item.description: Smyth County, Va. (Oct. 9, 2024) - FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance specialists documented the homes they visited in Smyth County, Va., on Oct. 9, where they provided residents with critical information about how to apply for disaster assistance following the impact of Hurricane Helene.

item.title: FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Team Visits Virginia Farm After Hurricane Helene
item.description: Smyth County, Va. (Oct. 9, 2024) - A cow across the road catches the attention of FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance Specialist Josh Meadows as he visits a Smyth County, Va., home to share information on applying for disaster assistance on Oct. 9. Checking farmland after a disaster like Hurricane Helene is crucial for assessing damage, ensuring animal welfare and providing support to farmers.

item.title: FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks Tours Greenville's Supply Center (008)
item.description: Greenville, S.C. (Oct. 8, 2024) - Greenville County Emergency Management Director Jessica Stumpf and Deputy Director Pierce Womack chaperones FEMA Deputy Administrator Erik Hooks as he tours Greenville's Supply Center where they house supplies for the ongoing recovery efforts from Hurricane Helene. The Deputy Administrator was also flanked by Greenville City Fire Chief Brian Horton, Division Chief David Hindman, South Carolina Emergency Management Division Director, Kim Stenson alongside FEMA Federal Coordinating Officer, Brett Howard.

item.description: Fairview, N.C. (Oct. 6, 2024) - U.S. Fire Administrator Dr. Lori Moore-Merrell embraces Garren Creek Fire Chief Wade Wright outside of the station on Saturday, October 6, 2024, in the Garren Creek community of Fairview, Buncombe County, North Carolina.

item.title: U.S. Fire Administator Dr. Lori Moore-Merrell Visits Garren Creek Fire Station in Buncombe County, NC (003)
item.description: Fairview, N.C. (Oct. 6, 2024) - Homes, vehicles and debris are swept together into piles across the Garren Creek community of Fairview, Buncombe County, North Carolina, on Saturday, October 6, 2024. Intense flooding pushed buildings and other structures down the mountainsides as floodwaters caused road collapses and the mountain gave way into landslides in many areas.

item.title: U.S. Fire Administator Dr. Lori Moore-Merrell Visits Garren Creek Fire Station in Buncombe County, NC (002)
item.description: Fairview, N.C. (Oct. 6, 2024) - U.S. Fire Administrator Dr. Lori Moore-Merrell embraces Garren Creek Fire Chief Wade Wright outside of the station on Saturday, October 6, 2024, in the Garren Creek community of Fairview, Buncombe County, North Carolina.

item.title: U.S. Fire Administator Dr. Lori Moore-Merrell Visits Garren Creek Fire Station in Buncombe County, NC (001)
item.description: Fairview, N.C. (Oct. 6, 2024) - The Garren Creek Fire Station remains undamaged while surrounded by flooding damage at every angle in the Garren Creek community of Fairview, Buncombe County, North Carolina, on Saturday, October 6, 2024. The fire station is only accessible by offroad vehicles after whole roads were washed away and a creek-turned-rushing waters carved new paths throughout the community.

item.title: Senior FEMA Offical Tours Aiken County, SC (008)
item.description: Aiken County, S.C. (Oct. 4, 2024) - Willie Nunn, Region 10 Administrator and Senior FEMA Official, in South Carolina alongside County Council Chairperson, Honorable Gary Bunker, and Aiken County Fire Chief President, Kerry Green, touring damaged areas and visiting volunteer fire stations around the county to personally thank volunteer firefighters for their critical role in initial response, and supporting their community. Regional Andministrator Willie Nunn, flanked by FEMA staff, provided a high-level overview of applying for assistance, and answered questions from the firefighters.

item.title: Administration for Strategic Preparedness and Response Responds to Hurricane Helene
item.description: In response to Hurricane Helene, the Administration for Strategic Preparedness and Response deployed hundreds of responders and hundreds of tons of medical equipment to support North Carolina communities as part of the government-wide response to the devastation caused by the hurricane. Responders from ASPR’s National Disaster Medical System began providing care on October 1, 2024. To learn more about this response, visit aspr.hhs.gov/hurricane-helene.  Photo provided by ASPR.

item.title: FEMA Disaster Survivor Assistance crews along with volunteers and non-profits offer food and supplies to Hurricane Helene survivors

Many organizations have donated items, including Operation Blessings and Mothers Helping Mothers, among others. Over 400 Hurricane Helene survivors have come by today to pick up food and cleaning supplies. Photo by Liz Roll/FEMA

item.title: Massachusetts Task Force 1 Responds to Hurricane Helene
item.description: Haywood County, NC-- Massachusetts Task Force 1 is working alongside federal, state, and local agencies to conduct urban search and rescue operations near Haywood County, NC. On September 27, members of MA-TF1 made successful rescues of two people and multiple pets during search and rescue operations in active flood areas. (Photo Credit: Scott McGuire, MA-TF1)

item.title: FEMA Truck on Standby at the Atlanta Distribution Center
item.description: Atlanta, Georgia (Sept. 25, 2024) A trailer truck idles outside of the Atlanta Distribution Center on Wednesday, September 25, 2024, in Atlanta, Ga. The supplies like water, food, blankets, tarps, cots & generators will be transported to the hurricane operations staging facility at Maxwell Air Force Base ahead of Tropical Storm Helene making landfall and affecting communities in Florida, Georgia and North Carolina.

item.title: Boxes of Emergency Supplies Ready to Mobilize in the Atlanta Distribution Center
item.description: Atlanta, Georgia (Sept. 25, 2024) Boxes of emergency supplies sit in the Atlanta Distribution Center on Wednesday, September 25, 2024, in Atlanta, Ga. The supplies like water, food, blankets, tarps, cots & generators will be transported to the hurricane operations staging facility at Maxwell Air Force Base ahead of Tropical Storm Helene making landfall and affecting communities in Florida, Georgia and North Carolina.

item.title: FEMA Staff Workers Prepare for Support in the Atlanta Distribution Center
item.description: Atlanta, Georgia (Sept. 25, 2024) FEMA staff work inside of the Atlanta Distribution Center on Wednesday, September 25, 2024, in Atlanta, Ga. Supplies like water, food, blankets, tarps, cots & generators will be transported to the hurricane operations staging facility at Maxwell Air Force Base ahead of Tropical Storm Helene making landfall and affecting communities in Florida, Georgia and North Carolina.

item.title: Emergency Supplies Pre-staged at Hurricane Operations in Montgomery, Ala.
item.description: FEMA employees process trucks arriving with emergency supplies to pre-stage at the hurricane operations staging facility at Maxwell Air Force Base on Tuesday, September 24, 2024, in Montgomery, Ala. Supplies like water, cots & generators were shipped from the Atlanta Distribution Center ahead of Tropical Storm Helene’s landfall to allow pre-positioning and quick distribution to hurricane-impacted areas in Georgia, Florida and North Carolina.
